dataIdInfo.idPurp: TTools is a multi-step suite of tools developed to sample geospatial data and assemble high-resolution data inputs into the Heat Source model, Washington Department of Ecology's Shade model, or the shade input file for CE-QUAL-W2.
dataIdInfo.idAbs: TTools is a multi-step suite of tools developed to sample geospatial data and assemble high-resolution data inputs into the Heat Source model, Washington Department of Ecology's Shade model, or the shade input file for CE-QUAL-W2. TTools enables users to segment stream centerlines into point features, measure channel width, compute stream elevation gradients, compute maximum topographic shade angles, and extract landcover metrics either using radial (star) or orthogonal sampling methods.

searchKeys.keyword: TTools is a multi-step suite of tools developed to sample geospatial data and assemble high-resolution data inputs into the Heat Source model
Washington Department of Ecology's Shade model
or the shade input file for CE-QUAL-W2.
